channel.title: Graham Cluley
channel.description: Computer security news, advice, and opinion

item.title: Ransomware costs show prevention is better than the cure
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description:
If you are worried about the financial hit of paying a ransom to cybercriminals, wait until you find out the true cost of a ransomware attack.
Read more in my article on the Tripwire State of Security blog.

item.title: Elon Musk says Twitter DMs should be end-to-end encrypted
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description:
Elon Musk's takeover of the company might bring a swathe of changes to Twitter, including the introduction of end-to-end encryption for direct messages (DMs).
Read more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

item.title: Smashing Security podcast #272: Going ape over the Kardashians, and the face of romance scams
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description:
Members of The Bored Ape Yacht Club get that sinking feeling, a face unwittingly launches hundreds of romance scams, and is an as-yet unseen Kim Kardashian sex tape a load of old Roblox?
All this and much more is discussed in the latest edition of the award-winning "Smashing Security" podcast by computer security veterans Graham Cluley and Carole Theriault, joined this week by BBC cyber correspondent Joe Tidy.

item.title: US offers $10 million reward for information about Russian military hackers implicated in NotPetya attack
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description:
The United States has made it $10 million harder to keep your mouth shut, if you happen to have any information about the Russian military hackers who masterminded the notorious NotPetya cyber attack.
Read more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

Using our database, you … Continue reading "Block over two billion known breached passwords from your AD with Specops Password Policy tools"

item.title: Ransomware attack attempted to destabilise Costa Rica, says outgoing president
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description:
Costa Rica's outgoing president, Carlos Alvarado Quesada, has said that a ransomware attack on the government's computer systems was an attempt to destabilise the country as it transitions to a new administration.
Read more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

item.title: Ukraine’s postal service prints stamp mocking sunken Russian ship, and gets hit by DDoS attack
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description: Someone isn't happy that Ukraine's post office has issued stamps mocking the sunken Russian navy flagship.

item.title: REvil reborn? Notorious gang’s dark web site redirects to new ransomware operation
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description:
Researchers have spotted that the TOR address used by the notorious REvil ransomware gang is now redirecting to a new website, with information about seemingly new attacks.
Read more in my article on the Tripwire State of Security blog.

item.title: Free Yanlouwang decryptor released, after flaw found in ransomware code
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description: Security researchers at Kaspersky have released a free decryption tool that promises to recover files for organisations hit by the Yanlouwang ransomware, meaning they don't have to pay the ransom.

item.title: Smashing Security podcast #271: Crypto break-in, Google blurring, and mics not muting
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description:
A man loses $650,000 from his cryptocurrency wallet after his Apple iCloud account is hacked, video conferencing apps may not be muting your mic quite the way you imagined, and Google has unblurred military bases in Russia... or has it?
All this and much more is discussed in the latest edition of the award-winning "Smashing Security" podcast by computer security veterans Graham Cluley and Carole Theriault, joined this week by The Cyberwire's Dave Bittner.

item.title: Apple iCloud account attack results in man losing $650,000 from his cryptocurrency wallet
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description:
Cryptocurrency wallet maker MetaMask has warned its 21 million monthly users to be wary of Apple iCloud backing up their app's data by default, after attackers successfully stole $650,000 of funds and NFTs.
Read more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

item.title: Funky Pigeon stalls orders after hackers breach its systems
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description:
Online greeting cards business Funky Pigeon was forced to close its doors temporarily last week after a "cybersecurity incident."
Visitors to the company's website were still being greeted as recently as Monday with a message saying that it could not accept new orders.

item.title: US Government warns of new malware attacks on ICS/SCADA systems
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description:
Agencies of the US Government have issued a joint warning that hackers have revealed their capability to gain full system access to industrial control systems that might help enemy states sabotage critical infrastructure.
Read more in my article on the Tripwire State of Security blog.

item.title: Smashing Security podcast #270: Bearded Barbie, EDR scams, and hobbyist crime detectives
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description:
Pulchritudinous women with glossy long hair are targeting Israeli officials via Facebook - but why? Scammers have found a new way to gain access to your most sensitive information - but how? And armchair detectives are helping investigating cold cases involving DNA - but should they?
All this and much more is discussed in the latest edition of the award-winning "Smashing Security" podcast by computer security veterans Graham Cluley and Carole Theriault, joined this week by Maria Varmazis.

item.title: RaidForums hacking site shut down by police, alleged admin arrested
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description:
One of the world’s largest hacker forums, which has been operating since 2015 helping cybercriminals sell and purchase the hacked personal data of millions of innocent people, has been taken down by the police.
Read more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

item.title: Security blind spots in the era of cloud communication & collaboration. Are you protected?

item.description: Graham Cluley Security News is sponsored this week by the folks at Perception Point. Thanks to the great team there for their support! item.title: CitySprint confirms security breach, warns delivery drivers their personal data may be in the hands of hackers
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description: Same-day delivery firm CitySprint has warned couriers it has suffered a data breach that may have allowed hackers to access their sensitive personal data.

item.title: “Pen tester” who helped FIN7 gang cause $1 billion damage, sentenced to five years behind bars
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description:
A Ukrainian man has been sentenced to five years in prison by a US court for his involvement in the notorious criminal hacking group, FIN7.
Read more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

item.title: Companies are more prepared to pay ransoms than ever before, reveals new report
item.dc:creator: Graham Cluley
item.description:
A new report shows that not only has there been a substantial increase in the percentage of companies that pay ransoms, but that the average size of ransomware payments has also increased significantly.
Read more in my article on the Tripwire State of Security blog.
